title: eBay and the Trust Economy
description: A quick, practical guide to eBay and the Trust Economy.

hook.text: In 1995, strangers sent money to other strangers online for used goods. Everyone said it was insane.

buildup.text: eBay's challenge wasn't technology. It was trustâ€”how do you buy from someone you've never met?

discovery.text: The star rating system was eBay's breakthrough. Reputation became currency in the digital marketplace.

twist.text: Sellers with perfect ratings earned 8% more than sellers with 98% ratings. Trust premiums are real.

climax.text: eBay proved that trust systems can replace physical stores. Every marketplace since has copied them.

punchline.text: Stars and reviews replaced handshakes and storefronts.

quiz.question: What was eBay's most important innovation for online commerce?
options: Offering the lowest prices on all products
Creating a reputation and rating system that built trust between strangers
Providing free shipping on all marketplace transactions
